elements.text:
Your boss tells everyone that tomorrow you'll divide into small groups to plan out new work projects. They also say that you'll have to pick your group, but you realize you don't have any close friends in your workplace.

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

texts: I am excited to make new friends.
I feel sad that no one knows me that well, but feel better thinking they will like me once they get to know me better.
I am nervous because I don't have any good ideas.
I feel driven to put my best work in.
I am scared that my group will exclude me, but know that this discussion will only last for a few minutes.
